summary: Merete Muff Rosen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in 1977. Payroll certifications from February, October, and December of 1977 list her as a committee staff member. A collection of personnel records specifically related to Rosen includes payroll authorizations, a relationship disclosure form, a leave record, and an inquiry regarding her character and qualifications. These records cover her employment during 1977.
significance: Merete Muff Rosen's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents suggest she was a staff member whose payroll and personnel records were maintained by the committee. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed, her employment is documented within the HSCA's records.
